He absolutely dislikes it when people record his words.
When he sees them, he always scolds them and says.
'Don't use your mouth.
Instead, remember what I said.
At another time, you'll sell me away.
The records of the pairs of teachers in this room today are all from the incense grove.
They all contain the incense grove's luminous teaching.
Take a piece of paper and use it as a robe.
I'll write them down as I go along.
Later scholars would hunt for words and languages.
They would fish for words and language.
It's like wanting to fill a blowing net.
They're either foolish or crazy.
Feiyue lu, vol. 20

source_sentence: 音釋　卷第十八之二十
translation: Sound Interpretation, Volume 18, Number 20

source_sentence: 謐(覓筆切音密靜語也安也)　丱(古患切音慣束髮如兩角貌)　爬(蒲巴切把搔也)　淦(古暗切音紺)　[跳-兆+典]跣(上音腆下先去聲徒足履地也)　媼(烏老切音襖女老之稱)　趯(他歷切音剔跳貌)　澀(色入切森入聲不滑也)　錮(亡慕切音故鑄銅鐵以塞隙也又禁錮重繫也)　鏴(音路)　瑤(他刀切音滔)　嗢(烏骨切音屋咽也)　噦(一决切淵入聲逆氣嘔也)　謴(吾困切音近混順言謔弄曰謴)　帔(兵臂切音轡裙屬)　尫(烏光切音汪曲頸也又瘠病之人)　桅(吾為切音危)　榸(卓皆切音齋枯木根)　揎(息全切音宣捋也引也)
